title: Six Years After Financial Crisis, Litigation Carries On With AIG Suit
teaser: Maurice "Hank" Greenberg, AIG's former CEO, is suing the U.S. government over the terms of the company's $85 billion bailout. He says it amounts to an unconstitutional seizure of private property.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
